definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Great changes took place in the l970s .
sentences.chinese: 在二十世紀七十年代發生了很大的變化。

sentences.english: Throughout the seventies, Charles and David continued to build Koch Industries.
sentences.chinese: 整個七十年代，查理斯和戴維協力擴張着科氏工業。

sentences.english: It was the mid-Seventies and I was your age.
sentences.chinese: 那是七十年代中期，我和你們差不多大。

sentences.english: In the late seventies, the O.T. material was still quite secret.
sentences.chinese: 七十年代末，OT材料仍十分神祕。

sentences.english: Another boho detail that was very popular in the '70s is suede.
sentences.chinese: 另一種七十年代非常流行的元素則是麂皮。
當時是二十世紀七十年代。

sentences.english: Retro, Pop Art, Seventies, and Cartoon.
sentences.chinese: 復古，普普藝術，七十年代，和卡通。

sentences.english: To be sure, there was a tremendous artistic efflorescence in the nineteen-seventies, the worst decade of the century for the New York economy.
sentences.chinese: 當然，在紐約經濟最低迷的七十年代，藝術繁榮發展。

sentences.english: There was a economic blast-off of Southeast Asian countries in the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 七十年代東南亞國家經歷了一次經濟騰飛。

sentences.english: In the mid-1970s, the first super computers appeared.
sentences.chinese: 七十年代中期出現了最初的超級計算機。

sentences.english: Also, by the late '70s, Carver and his wife had sobered up.
sentences.chinese: 到七十年代末期，卡佛夫婦也已經戒酒。

sentences.english: Rudi Voller was West Germany's premier striker during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 沃勒爾是上個世紀七十年代西德隊的主力射手。

sentences.english: He also made the vase on the bar back in the 70s when he was a potter.
sentences.chinese: 吧檯上的花瓶是他七十年代做的，那時他是個陶藝家。

sentences.english: It was the mid-1970s and I was your age.
sentences.chinese: 那是七十年代中期，我和你們差不多大。

definition: beginning of an age/beginning of a decade
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties)/age/era/period/CL:個|个[ge4]
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
the late Qing and early Republic, i.e. China around 1911
